intro: Lindera turfosa, commonly known as the creeping ligustrum, is a shrub native to eastern North America. It features aromatic, simple leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in early spring, followed by orange-red berries in the fall. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable plant for ecological restoration projects.
